meanings.definition: Assigning an incorrect date to something.
meanings.sent1: She misdated the letter, causing confusion.
meanings.sent2: He always misdates his assignments, making it hard to keep track.
meanings.sent3: The detective misdated the crime scene, leading to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her memory misdates events like a faulty clock.
meanings.sent5: The misdating of historical events can alter our understanding of the past.

meanings.sent1: They misdate the documents due to carelessness.
meanings.sent2: People often misdate important paperwork when rushing.
meanings.sent3: The professor misdating his own birthday on the calendar was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The misdating of the contract made the deal fall through.
meanings.sent5: Misdating can lead to misunderstandings and errors in record-keeping.
